December 20, 1956
Mr. Eue C. Johnson
Speech, Drama, and Radio-TV
Ricks College
Rexburg, Idaho
Dear Mr. Johnsons
Dr. Skornia has asked me to reply to your letter of December 13, requesting
information about membership in the NAEB. First I will give you a general
picture of HAEB membership and then I will attempt to answer your specific
questions*
The HAEB has categories of membership as follows!
Active - Educational institutions, public service organisations, etc.
owning and operating their own radio and/or TV stations.
Associate - Institutions (as above) not owning stations, but operating
production centers and regularly producing programs over a
commercial outlet.
Affiliate - Organizations interested in the general furtherance of educÂ¬
ational broadcasting.
Individual - All persons interested in or seeking to promote educational,
cultural and public service broadcasting.
For Active members with radio stations, dues in the Association are based on
rated transmitter power as follows!
Class A - 5 kw and over $50.00
Class B - 1 to 4*9 kw 25.00
Class C - less than 1 kw 15.00
Television stations with less than 5 kw video power pay $50 and those with 5 kw
or more video power pay $100.
Associate and Affiliate members pay $10 a year; Individual members pay $5*00.
For this fee members receive our monthly newsletters the HAEB Journal (formerly
the AERT Journal); the various reports and surveys we publish periodically}
services of our Placement Service, television engineer, legal counsel, management
consultant, etc.; plus the normal day to day services, information, and advice
